item.title: Review of Festival Napa Valley 2016 - Best of the Fest
item.description:
Review of Festival Napa Valley 2016 - Best of the Fest

Review of 60 events celebrating the superstars of opera, symphony, dance, theater, wine, food and art during this once in a lifetime events in the very picturesque Napa Valley NAPA, CA, July 28, 2016 -Festival Napa Valley just wrapped up 10 glorious days of music, wine, food and art.

Napa Valley Grapegrowers and Napa Valley Vintners announced first wine grapes of the 2016 Napa Valley vintage have come from vineyard to crush pad for

item.title: Napa quake business survivors asked to help prepare nation for disasters
item.description:
Napa quake business survivors asked to help prepare nation for disasters

Businesses could be better prepared for the next "big one," with a tool being developed with the help of those who rode through the Napa earthquake two years ago this month. According to the United States Geological Services, the Napa quake was the largest earthquake in more than 25 years to hit the San Francisco Bay Area.

item.title: 8 Chic New Reasons to Spend the Weekend in Napa County
item.description:
8 Chic New Reasons to Spend the Weekend in Napa County

Here at 7x7, we are big advocates for the quick-but-glorious weekend trip. And isn't that half the reason we live in the Bay Area anyhow-for the many magical escapes that are actually so nearby? When you feel the need to leave the city behind, we recommend renting a hot ride and making haste for Nap...

item.title: The Hottest Hotel Opening In Napa Valley This Fall
item.description:
The Hottest Hotel Opening In Napa Valley This Fall

A new luxury hotel in Napa Valley with gorgeous vineyard views, Las Alcobas is set to open in October.

item.title: When Your Dinner Guest Orders a $700 Bottle of Wine: An Etiquette Guide
item.description:
When Your Dinner Guest Orders a $700 Bottle of Wine: An Etiquette Guide

A HIGH-PRICED RESTAURANT experience, complete with a wine hijacking, wasn't a topic I expected to discuss during a routine dental checkup and cleaning last month. But that's exactly what my dentist, David Silverstrom, wanted to talk about when I sat down in his chair.

item.title: Matt Miller: A pleasant stroll down memory lane in the Napa Valley
item.description:
Matt Miller: A pleasant stroll down memory lane in the Napa Valley

The Napa Valley I grew up in was far different than the one I visited last weekend. There was more open space between the wineries that dot the famed landscape along Highway 29 to Calistoga. Now there are entrepreneurs along the entire route - and Silverado Trail for that matter - extolling the virtues of their Merlots, Zinfandels and Cabernet Sauvignons.

item.title: Coombsville Is Coming of Age
item.description:
Coombsville Is Coming of Age

Recently, the Coombsville Vintners and Growers (CVG) hosted their first-ever media tasting in the sprawling new caves of the magnificent Covert Estate. This tasting marked a big step forward for the Coombsville AVA and will sharpen the focus on the newest, and for many, the most individualistic of Napa Valley's sixteen AVAs.
